marketNews.title: Indonesia Economy Slows to +4.95% YoY in 3Q24
marketNews.content: Indonesian Gross Domestic Product (GDP) grew by +1.5% QoQ and +4.95% YoY in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: +5.05% YoY), which was lower than the consensus expectation of +1.6% QoQ and +5% YoY. [These results] mark the slowest annual economic growth since 3Q23 and bring the economic growth for 9M24 to only +5.03% YoY, lower than the government target of +5.2% YoY. From the expenditure side, domestic consumption growth - which contributed 2.55 percentage points to the annual economic growth in 3Q24 - slightly weakened to +4.91% YoY (vs. 2Q24: +4.93% YoY). Meanwhile, exports (+9.09% YoY vs. 2Q24: +8.28% YoY) grew lower than imports (+11.47% YoY vs. 2Q24: +7.79% YoY), causing net exports to contribute negatively by 0.08 percentage point to the annual economic growth in 3Q24. Government spending (+4.62% YoY vs. 2Q24: +1.42% YoY) and gross fixed capital formation (+5.15% YoY vs. 2Q24: +4.43% YoY) experienced increased growth in 3Q24, with contributions of 0.32 percentage point and 1.63 percentage points, respectively. Spatially, weaker economic growth was suppressed by the Java and Sumatra regions. Economic growth on these two islands reached only +4.92% YoY and +4.48% YoY in 3Q24, much lower than Maluku and Papua (+6% YoY), Sulawesi (+5.87% YoY), Bali and Nusa Tenggara (+5.28% YoY), and Kalimantan (+5.2% YoY). The release of 3Q24 economic growth data came just a few days after BPS [announced] that Indonesian consumer price index inflation slowed to 1.71% in October 2024 (vs. September 2024: 1.84% YoY inflation), marking the lowest level since October 2021.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: Inflation Weakness and Downtrading Trends
marketNews.content: The weakening inflation trend and economic growth realization below expectations can be an indicator of weakening public purchasing power, leading to a downtrading phenomenon as we have written in Stockbit Snips. This phenomenon can be a positive catalyst for consumer issuers with product positioning in the 'value' segment, such as Tempo Scan Pacific (TSPC). We have also released the TSPC Unboxing which you can read here. Nevertheless, we see a shifting trend in growth drivers from Java and Sumatra to other islands. We also observe this trend in retail issuers - such as ACES (as we have written here) and MIDI - which are experiencing more significant growth outside of Java, along with the corporation's future strategy to be more expansive outside Java.

tickerNews.title: ADRO: Additional Dividend up to IDR 1,349/Share
tickerNews.content: ADRO: Adaro Energy Indonesia [announced] that there are 2 agenda items in the EGM on November 18, 2024, namely: (1) the distribution of additional dividends for the 2023 fiscal year up to 2.6 billion US dollars, equivalent to ~1,349 rupiah per share assuming an exchange rate of rupiah against the US dollar at 15,778; and (2) a change of company name to introduce a new identity. Referring to the closing price of ADRO shares on Monday (4/11) at the level of 3,930 rupiah per share, this dividend indicates a dividend yield of up to 34.3%. This corporate action plan is part of the spin-off of ADRO's thermal coal subsidiary, PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AAI).

tickerNews.title: MEDC: Medco Energi Targets 145-150 MBOEPD Oil and Gas Production in 2025
tickerNews.content: MEDC: [Bisnis] reported that Medco Energi Internasional targets oil and gas (migas) production of 145-150 MBOEPD in 2025 (vs. 2024 target: 145 MBOEPD), lower than the realization during 9M24 which reached 153 MBOEPD. The 2025 migas production cost is targeted to be below 10 US dollars per BOE, the same as the 2024 target, where realization was only 7.7 US dollars per BOE during 9M24. Meanwhile, electricity sales are targeted to reach 4,500 GWh in 2025 (vs. 2024 target: 4,100 GWh). During 9M24, MEDC had realized electricity sales of 2,961 GWh.

tickerNews.title: GIAA: Ministry of SOEs Plans to Replace Garuda Indonesia CEO Amid Turnaround Efforts
tickerNews.content: GIAA: [Bloomberg] reported that the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises plans to replace the President Director position at Garuda Indonesia as part of the government's efforts to improve profitability and support the company's expansion. Bloomberg sources mentioned that the replacement of GIAA's President Director could occur as early as mid-November 2024, with the Acting President Director of Lion Air, Wamildan Tsani Panjaitan, and GIAA's Finance Director, Prasetio, being potential candidates for the position. The Ministry of SOEs has not commented on this issue. Bloomberg sources also mentioned that the government plans to increase GIAA's profitability by increasing its fleet from the current number of about 100 aircraft to more than 150 aircraft.

tickerNews.title: TBLA: Tunas Baru Lampung to Distribute Interim Dividend of IDR 35/Share for 2024
tickerNews.content: TBLA: Tunas Baru Lampung will [distribute] an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 211 billion rupiah or 35 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 12, 2024, with payment on December 4, 2024. Referring to the TBLA share price at the closing of Tuesday trading (5/11) at the level of 690 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 5.1%.

tickerNews.title: TOTL: Total Bangun Persada Secured New Contracts Value of IDR 4.4 Trillion until October 2024
tickerNews.content: TOTL: [Kontan] reported that Total Bangun Persada has secured new contract value of 4.4 trillion rupiah during 10M24, equivalent to 98% of the 2024 target of 4.5 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ISAT: Indosat Provides Shareholder Loan of IDR 555 Billion to Its Subsidiary for Capex Investment
tickerNews.content: ISAT: Indosat together with its subsidiary, PT Aplikanusa Lintasarta, [provided] a shareholder loan amounting to 555 billion rupiah to its subsidiary, PT Starone Mitra Telekomunikasi. The loan has an interest rate of 9.25% and is intended to finance capital expenditure investment. PT Starone Mitra Telekomunikasi itself is a joint venture in the data center field owned by ISAT along with BDX Asia Data Center Holdings Pte. Ltd.

tickerNews.title: AVIA: Avia Avian to Distribute Interim Dividend of IDR 11/Share for 2024
tickerNews.content: AVIA: Avia Avian will [distribute] an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year up to 673 billion rupiah or 11 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 12, 2024, with payment on November 21, 2024. Referring to the AVIA share price at the closing of Tuesday trading (5/11) at the level of 476 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 2.3%.

tickerNews.title: MARK: Mark Dynamics Indonesia to Distribute Interim Dividend of IDR 20/Share for 2024
tickerNews.content: MARK: Mark Dynamics Indonesia will [distribute] an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 76 billion rupiah or 20 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 13, 2024, with payment on December 5, 2024. Referring to the MARK share price at the closing of Tuesday trading (5/11) at the level of 1,140 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 1.8%.

tickerNews.title: TOTO: Controllers PT Multifortuna Asindo and PT Suryaparamitra Abadi Sell Shares on Free Float Compliance
tickerNews.content: TOTO: The controller of Surya Toto Indonesia, PT Multifortuna Asindo and PT Suryaparamitra Abadi, sold 12.5 million TOTO shares and 2.3 million TOTO shares, respectively, at prices of 200 rupiah per share and 227 rupiah per share on October 31, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~3.3 billion rupiah and was intended to comply with free float provisions. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Multifortuna Asindo and PT Suryaparamitra Abadi in TOTO decreased from 29.51% and 25.05% to 29.39% and 25.03%, respectively.

tickerNews.title: Open Unemployment Rate at 4.91% in August 2024; Formal Sector Employment Rises
tickerNews.content: BPS [recorded] that the open unemployment rate in Indonesia in August 2024 reached 4.91%, down -0.41 percentage point compared to August 2023. A total of 60.81 million people (42.05%) worked in the formal sector in August 2024, an increase of +1.16 percentage point compared to August 2023. Meanwhile, the number of underemployed (8%) in August 2024 increased by +1.32 percentage point compared to August 2023, while part-time workers (23.94%) decreased by -0.46 percentage point.

tickerNews.title: Minister of ESDM to Submit New Energy Subsidy Scheme Within One Week
tickerNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, [said] that his office plans to submit the formulation of a new energy subsidy scheme to President Prabowo Subianto within one week. Bahlil mentioned that the liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) subsidy policy will not change, while details of fuel oil (BBM) and electricity subsidies are still under review. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto planned to change energy subsidy schemes to direct cash assistance to save 200 trillion rupiah in the budget.

tickerNews.title: President Prabowo Signs Government Regulation on Debt Forgiveness for MSMEs in Agriculture and Fisheries
tickerNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto [on Tuesday] (5/11) signed Government Regulation Number 47 of 2024 concerning the write-off of non-performing loans for micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in the agriculture, plantation, livestock, fishery, and marine sectors, as well as other MSMEs.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia to Start Battery Cell Production in 2026, Potential Buyers Already Identified
tickerNews.content: Minister of SOEs, Erick Thohir, [said] that the battery cell factory joint venture owned by PT Industri Baterai Indonesia (Indonesia Battery Corporation) and CBL International Development Pte. Ltd. is targeted to start production activities in 2026 and already has potential buyers. Nevertheless, Erick declined to disclose who these potential buyers are. Erick also mentioned that his side would approach Ford Motor Company and Volkswagen to invest in Indonesia. The approach to potential buyers will be carried out concurrently with President Prabowo Subianto's overseas visits in the coming weeks. Previously, the President Director of Indonesia Battery Corporation, Toto Nugroho, stated that the battery cell factory would have a capacity of 15 GWh.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia Investment Authority and Granite Asia to Invest up to $1.2 Billion in Indonesian Tech Sector
tickerNews.content: Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, Indonesia Investment Authority, along with Singapore-based venture capital firm Granite Asia, [announced] a fund of up to 1.2 billion US dollars dedicated to the Indonesian technology sector. However, both parties did not mention the recipients or the number of companies that will receive these funds.

tickerNews.title: BMKG Predicts Normal to Above-Normal Rainfall in Most of Indonesia in 2025, Suitable for Food Production
tickerNews.content: Head of BMKG, Dwikorita Karnawati, [said] that rainfall in most of Indonesia in 2025 will be normal to above normal, which is suitable to support food production. Dwikorita mentioned that a weak La Nina weather pattern - which usually brings more rainfall - will occur between November 2024-March 2025. Previously, Indonesia experienced a dry weather pattern in 2023 due to El Nino, which caused planting delays in early 2024 and a -2.43% YoY decrease in rice production this year.

tickerNews.title: HATM: Habco Trans Maritima Acquires One Bulk Carrier Ship for $12.5 Million
tickerNews.content: Habco Trans Maritima (HATM) [announced] that it has purchased 1 unit of a bulk carrier ship for 12.5 million US dollars from Indian Ocean Ltd. The acquisition is intended to increase carriage capacity and accommodate the needs of the commodity transportation market.

tickerNews.title: BUDI: Budi Starch & Sweetener to Distribute Interim Dividend of IDR 5/Share for 2024
tickerNews.content: Budi Starch & Sweetener (BUDI) will [distribute] an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~22.5 billion rupiah or 5 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 12, 2024, with payment on December 4, 2024. Referring to the BUDI share price at the closing of Tuesday trading (5/11) at the level of 228 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 2.2%.
